description: Unique identifier of the asset whose usage meter is tracked; joins to the asset master record.
Operational classification of the asset for fleet and maintenance purposes; values may be descriptive categories or internal codes.
Unit of measure tracked by the meter, e.g., distance or runtime, used to interpret readings and schedule maintenance.
Starting reading recorded when this meter tracking began, often the installation or baseline value used to calculate subsequent usage.
Most recent recorded meter reading for the asset.
Lifetime-to-date usage total for the asset, likely accumulating across meter resets or replacements; may incorporate offsets and rollovers. Confirm with SME.
Free-text description of the meter or its context for this asset.
Date the meter tracking became effective for this asset, such as installation or baseline start.
Date the meter record expires or is deactivated, after which it should no longer be used.
Most recent date the physical or logical meter rolled over to zero due to capacity limits.
User or process that created this meter record.
Timestamp when the meter record was created.
User or process that last modified this meter record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this meter record.
Sequence number distinguishing multiple meter rows for the same asset; used for ordering or uniqueness.
Adjustment factor applied to lifetime totals to account for prior usage, replacements, or rollovers.
